channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘The First Descendant’ Gives Out Apology Rewards For Issues, Here’s How To Claim
item.description: The First Descendant's launch could have been smoother, and Nexon is offering login rewards for players who tolerated it.

item.title: Software done well
item.description: There are a few tools I use regularly that make me smile, because the craftspeople who made them decided to build something with extra magic and care....

item.title: Where The Top Six Potential Biden Replacements Land On Crypto
item.description: Crypto has become a hot-button issue as election season moves into fall. Are any likely to duplicate former President Donald Trump’s recent embrace of...

item.title: Avoiding the trap questions
item.description: A trick question is designed to fool us into proposing the wrong answer (example below). A trap question, on the other hand, stops the train completel...

item.title: Introducing New Tech? How To Get Resistant Team Members On Board
item.description: Some team members may be hesitant or even anxious when their organization retires or adds to the technology tools they’re accustomed to and comfortabl...

item.title: Plasticity
item.description: It’s pretty easy for some kids to switch gears. They can go from sad to ebullient in seconds, and switch contexts without much fuss. Others have more ...

item.title: ‘Destiny 2’ Is Now Making Players Hoard Bounties And Challenges With XP Cut-Off
item.description: Destiny 2 is now locking the season pass for players who cannot even overlevel to claim rewards when the next Act drops.

item.title: The lazy jugglers
item.description: The best jugglers don’t seem to be trying very hard. That’s because they understand what the work involves, and they don’t confuse effort with results...

item.title: What The Roadrunner Teaches Us About Adversarial Intelligence
item.description: The roadrunner and Wile E. Coyote have a lot to teach us about how new AI models work.
